intro: Parnassia kangdingensis, commonly known as the Kangding parnassia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, greenish fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
